metadata.title: CVE-2017-3135 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Under some conditions when using both DNS64 and RPZ to rewrite queryresponses, query processing can resume in an inconsistent state leading toeither an INSIST assertion failure or an attempt to read through a NULLpointer. Affects BIND 9.8.8, 9.9.3-S1 -> 9.9.9-S7, 9.9.3 -> 9.9.9-P5,9.9.10b1, 9.10.0 -> 9.10.4-P5, 9.10.5b1, 9.11.0 -> 9.11.0-P2, 9.11.1b1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3135` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.13
bind9-host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.13
bind9utils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.13
dnsutils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.13
host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.13
libbind9-90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.13
libdns100 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.13
libisc95 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.13
libisccc90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.13
libisccfg90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.13
liblwres90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.13
lwresd - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.13').
